text: uh oh, this isn’t good. Inspect doesn’t display type sizes for any of the text layers. labels them `font-size: NaNpx;`
returns the same error for line-height as well
also, font-weight is kind of inconsistent, though not necessarily incorrect. some layer labeled “medium” some labeled “300"
aaaaand letter-spacing is _super_ incorrect. PS tracking of “10” is not the same as 10px of letter-spacing
Ok good to know. I will bring up with our InVision contact today, but maybe zeplin is the better choice
I also noticed yesterday zeplin has a style guide tab, which you can set from the code

attachments.title: Zeplin, Sketch Measure, and InVision Inspect —
attachments.text: Comparing Design Spec Tools for UI Development
attachments.fallback: Zeplin, Sketch Measure, and InVision Inspect —

text: sounds like one more vote for zeplin in this article
from what i can tell examining our current test project in Zeplin it has a much more robust handle on type properties. not to mention it’s seemingly more accurate
it even pulls out multiple type styles on type layers that have more than one style
yep, I think the invision inspect tool sounds like it's not mature enough for us to count on for redlines
i agree. though like that article mentioned, i’d be curious to know how it evolves over time. these tools have a habit of turning into something great once they iron out the hiccups
yea, thought it would be helpful
<@U0XCJ372R> <@U0XJFPSRL> let's try library for this invision review
hey all, in our call with our invision rep, we learned that we should use Craft Sync instead of InVision Sync

They also encouraged us to reach out to support for the specific issues that <@U026E0ZNR> encountered. They think there may be changes available in our export setup that would resolve those issues. And they promised their support is helpful & fast.
I’m not entirely sure how to tell the difference between the two. I installed Sync with the Craft 2 app I downloaded, but the plugin is only labeled “Sync (Beta)”
That's the one you want to use. Invision sync is a separate download/setup process
